item.title: Tata Power Issues ₹2,000 Crore Non-Convertible Debentures on Private Placement Basis
item.description: Top News Tata Power Issues ₹2,000 Crore Non-Convertible Debentures on Private Placement Basis just now Tata Power announces ₹2,000.00 crore NCD issuance through private placement, comprising 2,00,000 debentures with ₹1,00,000.00 face value each. The unsecured NCDs feature two series with 3-year and 5-year maturity options, bullet repayment structure, and AA/Stable credit ratings. The debentures will be listed on BSE debt segment with deemed allotment date of December 19, 2025.

item.title: VST Tillers Tractors Showcases Advanced Engineering Solutions at EXCON
item.description: VST Tillers Tractors Showcases Advanced Engineering Solutions at EXCON 13 minutes ago VST Tillers Tractors participated in EXCON in Bengaluru, showcasing its evolution from a farm equipment manufacturer to a diversified engineering company. The company displayed advanced compact engines (3 and 4-cylinder, 17HP to 30HP) and precision components for various industries. A key highlight was the 13HP horizontal engine, supporting both agriculture and construction. VST's engines are contributing to India's infrastructure development. CEO Antony Cherukara emphasized the company's focus on innovation, precision engineering, and global market expansion. VST's quality has been recognized through multiple awards, reinforcing its commitment to excellence.

item.title: Market Wrap: Nifty and Sensex Climb Over 0.5% in Positive Close
item.description: Market Wrap: Nifty and Sensex Climb Over 0.5% in Positive Close 2 hours ago Indian markets closed positively on December 12, with Nifty 50 breaching 26,000 and Sensex surpassing 85,000. The session saw a broad-based rally with 61% of traded stocks advancing. InterGlobe Aviation clarified no SEBI investigation and disclosed a CGST penalty. Infosys witnessed significant promoter share sales.

item.title: Swati Projects Limited Reports Strong Q2FY26 Results with Consolidated Net Profit of ₹517.65 Lakh
item.description: Swati Projects Limited Reports Strong Q2FY26 Results with Consolidated Net Profit of ₹517.65 Lakh 3 hours ago Swati Projects Limited announced unaudited Q2FY26 results, showing significant consolidated growth. Consolidated total income surged to ₹2,361.20 lakh, a 5,549.20% increase from Q2FY25. Net profit rose by 1,982.73% to ₹517.65 lakh. Standalone operations remained stable with a 12.83% increase in income. The company's consolidated half-year performance was strong, with total income of ₹2,424.33 lakh and net profit of ₹452.57 lakh. The company maintains full regulatory compliance and a strong financial position.
